alert.note: Alert for Crittenden (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 01 at 8:42PM CST until March 01 at 11:20PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of East Arkansas and North Mississippi, including the following counties, in East Arkansas, Crittenden, Lee, Phillips and St. Francis. In North Mississippi, Tunica. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 842 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Marianna, Hughes, Marvell, St Francis National Park, Helena- West Helena, Lexa, Moro, Rondo, Aubrey, Haynes, Brickeys, Garret Grove, Watkins Corner, Pinckney, Lagrange, Scott Valley, Jeffersonville, Haleside, Felton and Soudan. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
